tool.name: paffy dechunk
tool.description: manipulates coordinates to allow aggregation of PAFs computed over subsequences
tool.command: #if $input_paf.ext.endswith(".gz") ## gunzip does not work with stdin here like the other wrapped tools (unknown why), so we create a temp file. gunzip -c '$input_paf' > temp.paf && #else: ## Copy input file to the same temp file which gets referenced below. cp '$input_paf' temp.paf && #end if paffy dechunk --logLevel "INFO" --outputFile '$out_file' --inputFile temp.paf
tool.help: Paffy dechunk adjusts PAF alignment coordinates that were produced by ´faffy chunk´. This tool removes that chunk-specific encoding and converts all alignments back to the original, global coordinate system. For this, the query and target names in each alignment must contain their chunk-specific encoding (delimited by ``|``, e.g.: ``Name|Length|Start``).
